channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: World Model on Million-Length Video And Language With RingAttention
item.description: This work paves the way for training on massive datasets of long video and language to develop understanding of both human knowledge and the multimodal world, and broader capabilities.

item.title: UFO: A UI-Focused Agent for Windows OS Interaction
item.description: We introduce UFO, an innovative UI-Focused agent to fulfill user requests tailored to applications on Windows OS, harnessing the capabilities of GPT-Vision.

item.title: DoRA: Weight-Decomposed Low-Rank Adaptation
item.description: By employing DoRA, we enhance both the learning capacity and training stability of LoRA while avoiding any additional inference overhead.

item.title: Generative Representational Instruction Tuning
item.description: Notably, we find that GRIT matches training on only generative or embedding data, thus we can unify both at no performance loss.

item.title: YOLO-World: Real-Time Open-Vocabulary Object Detection
item.description: The You Only Look Once (YOLO) series of detectors have established themselves as efficient and practical tools.

item.title: BitDelta: Your Fine-Tune May Only Be Worth One Bit
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are typically trained in two phases: pre-training on large internet-scale datasets, and fine-tuning for downstream tasks.

item.title: Lag-Llama: Towards Foundation Models for Probabilistic Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Over the past years, foundation models have caused a paradigm shift in machine learning due to their unprecedented capabilities for zero-shot and few-shot generalization.

item.title: Guiding Instruction-based Image Editing via Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: Extensive experimental results demonstrate that expressive instructions are crucial to instruction-based image editing, and our MGIE can lead to a notable improvement in automatic metrics and human evaluation while maintaining competitive inference efficiency.

item.title: Scalable Diffusion Models with Transformers
item.description: We explore a new class of diffusion models based on the transformer architecture.

item.title: The boundary of neural network trainability is fractal
item.description: Some fractals -- for instance those associated with the Mandelbrot and quadratic Julia sets -- are computed by iterating a function, and identifying the boundary between hyperparameters for which the resulting series diverges or remains bounded.

item.title: GraphCast: Learning skillful medium-range global weather forecasting
item.description: Global medium-range weather forecasting is critical to decision-making across many social and economic domains.

item.title: Fiddler: CPU-GPU Orchestration for Fast Inference of Mixture-of-Experts Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) based on Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architecture are showing promising performance on various tasks.

item.title: Self-Play Fine-Tuning Converts Weak Language Models to Strong Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we delve into the prospect of growing a strong LLM out of a weak one without the need for acquiring additional human-annotated data.

item.title: Mobile-Agent: Autonomous Multi-Modal Mobile Device Agent with Visual Perception
item.description: To assess the performance of Mobile-Agent, we introduced Mobile-Eval, a benchmark for evaluating mobile device operations.

item.title: MagicPose: Realistic Human Poses and Facial Expressions Retargeting with Identity-aware Diffusion
item.description: In this work, we propose MagicPose, a diffusion-based model for 2D human pose and facial expression retargeting.

item.title: Fast Timing-Conditioned Latent Audio Diffusion
item.description: Generating long-form 44. 1kHz stereo audio from text prompts can be computationally demanding.

item.title: Forgedit: Text Guided Image Editing via Learning and Forgetting
item.description: Text guided image editing on real images given only the image and the target text prompt as inputs, is a very general and challenging problem, which requires the editing model to reason by itself which part of the image should be edited, to preserve the characteristics of original image, and also to perform complicated non-rigid editing.

item.title: Prismatic VLMs: Investigating the Design Space of Visually-Conditioned Language Models
item.description: Visually-conditioned language models (VLMs) have seen growing adoption in applications such as visual dialogue, scene understanding, and robotic task planning; adoption that has fueled a wealth of new models such as LLaVa, InstructBLIP, and PaLI-3.

item.title: MaskNet: Introducing Feature-Wise Multiplication to CTR Ranking Models by Instance-Guided Mask
item.description: We also turn the feed-forward layer in DNN model into a mixture of addictive and multiplicative feature interactions by proposing MaskBlock in this paper.

item.title: Data Engineering for Scaling Language Models to 128K Context
item.description: We demonstrate that continual pretraining of the full model on 1B-5B tokens of such data is an effective and affordable strategy for scaling the context length of language models to 128K.
